newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia Post year profit up 3.8 pct.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia Post year profit up 3.8 pct.

text.p: Australian government-owned postal service, Australia Post, said on Tuesday its pre-tax and pre-abnormal annual profit rose 3.8 percent to A$344.1 million in the 1995/96 year June 30.
Dividend was increased 18.8 percent for the year to A$142.6 million, Australia Post said in a statement.
Australia Post chairman Maurice Williams said mail volumes were up 5.7 percent to a record 4.0 billion articles.
Expenditure increased to A$2.6 billion, with labour and related costs accounting for 60 percent of total outlays.
"We have reduced labour costs substantially over time, but our business will continue to be labour intensive," Williams said.
"Standard and Poor's reconfirmation of Post's triple-A credit rating acknowledges our financial strength and ability to tackle future opportunities," he said.
Australia Post managing director Graeme John said continued price restraint and high delivery reliability had combined to lift mail usage further over the year.
"While change in the communications industry is accelerating, technology will bring improvements to the mail service, but not replace it," Williams said.
